description.text: Contains the static nameplate attributes attached to the battery.

The battery passport identifier is the unique identifier of a battery passport. 

DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.2.1

Information identifying the manufacturer with a name.


DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.2.4

The manufacturer information postal address, indicating a single contact point. Web address, if available; and web address, if available. 


DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.2.3


Note: This is drop-in of the ContactInformation Submodel

The battery identifier should be serialised, i.e., identifying each battery via a serial number.


DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.2.2

The manufacturing date should not only relate to the battery model, but to the battery item.
The date code should comply with DINISO8601-1:2020-12 and ISO8601-2:2019.


DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.3.2

The manufacturing place should be uniquely identifiable.


DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.3.1

A battery passport must include information on the life cycle status of the battery.

The status of the battery must be defined as 'original' (0173-1#07-ACC020#001), 'repurposed'(0173-1#07-ACC021#001), 're-used'(0173-1#07-ACC022#001), 'remanufactured' (0173-1#07-ACC023#001) or 'waste' (0173-1#07-ACC024#001).

A new battery passport must be issued when a battery was subject to remanufacturing, repurpose or one of the treatment operations preparing for re-use and preparing for repurpose and is placed on the market again.


DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.3.7

Should be used to provide all relevant marking information of the battery passport based on DIN DKE SPEC 99100 such as:

* Separate collection symbol (6.2.2)

* Symbols for cadmium and lead (6.2.3)

* Carbon footprint label (6.2.4)

* Extinguishing agent (6.2.5)

* Meaning of labels and symbols (6.2.6)

Note: CE marking is declared as mandatory according to EU Blue Guide
Used to provide all relevant marking information of the battery passport based on DIN SPEC 99100.

Context name of the symbols, labels and documentation of conformity based on DIN DKE SPEC 99100:

* "Separate collection symbol" (6.2.2)

* "Symbols for cadmium and lead" (6.2.3)

* "Carbon footprint label" (6.2.4)

* "Extinguishing agent" (6.2.5)
Note: Approval identifier, reference to the certificate number, to be entered without spaces
Note: format by lexical representation: CCYY-MM-DD Note: to be specified to the day
Note: format by lexical representation: CCYY-MM-DD Note: to be specified to the day

Text should be used to provide the meaning of labels and symbols.

DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.2.5, 6.2.6

EU declaration of conformity

DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.2.7

Document identifier of the document (e.g., PDF) that can be found in the HandoverDocumentation Submodel.

DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.2.7

Results of test reports proving compliance
DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.2.8

Document identifier of the document (e.g., PDF) that can be found in the HandoverDocumentation Submodel.

DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.2.8

displayName.text: results of test reports proving compliance

definition.text: legally valid designation of the natural or judicial person which is directly responsible for the design, production, packaging and labeling of a product in respect to its being brought into circulation

The manufacturing date should not only relate to the battery model, but to the battery item.

definition.text: where applicable, additional information on the marking in plain text, e.g. the ID-number of the notified body involved in the conformity process

description.text:
Should be used to provide all relevant marking information of the battery passport based on DIN DKE SPEC 99100 such as:

* separate collection symbol (6.2.2)

* symbols for cadmium and lead (6.2.3)

* Carbon footprint labela (6.2.4)

* extinguishing agent

* meaning of labels and symbols (6.2.6)

* EU declaration of conformity

* results of test reports proving compliance

* Date of putting the battery into service

Note: CE marking is declared as mandatory according to EU Blue Guide

definition.text: Single marking information

description.text:
The manufacturing place should be uniquely identifiable.

DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.3.1

definition.text: unique string of characters for the identification of locations or buildings involved in a products value chain or used by actors involved in a products value chain
unique combination of numbers and letters used to identify the device once it has been manufactured

A battery passport must include the EU declaration of conformity.

  DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.2.7 

 Document identifiers (e.g., depending of different languages) of a document (e.g., PDF) that can be found in the Handover Documentation model.

displayName.text: results of test reports proving compliance

preferredName.text: result of test reports proving compliance

definition.text:
A battery passport must include the test report results that can prove the compliance with the requirements stated in the battery regulation.

  DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.2.8

 Document identifiers (e.g., depending of different languages) of a document (e.g., PDF) that can be found in the Handover Documentation model.

A battery passport must include information on the life cycle status of the battery.
   
   The status of the battery must be defined as 'original' (0173-1#07-ACC020#001), 'repurposed'(0173-1#07-ACC021#001), 're-used'(0173-1#07-ACC022#001), 'remanufactured' (0173-1#07-ACC023#001) or 'waste' (0173-1#07-ACC024#001).
   
   A new battery passport must be issued when a battery was subject to remanufacturing, repurpose or one of the treatment operations preparing for re-use and preparing for repurpose and is placed on the market again.
   
   DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.3.7

The unique operator identifier should comply with ISO/IEC 15459 1:2014, ISO/IEC 15459 2:2015, ISO/IEC 15459 3:2014, ISO/IEC 15459 4:2014, ISO/IEC 15459 5:2014, ISO/IEC 15459 6:2014, or their equivalent until referenced harmonised standards are listed in the OJEU.

DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.2.3

A battery passport must include information identifying the manufacturer.


DIN DKE Spec 99100 chapter reference: 6.1.2
Sammlung von verschiedenen Kennzeichnungen, die sich auf das Produkt beziehen
collection of several markings relevant to the product

Where appropriate, the battery passport must include information on the date of putting the battery into service. BR Annex VI Part A (1); Art. 3(33); Art. 38(7); ESPR Art. 2(32)\n\nDIN DKE Spec chapter reference: 6.1.3.3
